intro: Lampranthus mutans, commonly known as the variable firecracker, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its striking, brightly colored flowers that come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. It is a succulent, meaning it stores water in its fleshy leaves and stems, allowing it to survive in arid environments. Lampranthus mutans typically blooms in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
